report.title: Locations with geometry for location type
report.description: List of locations (with geometry) for a given location type whose parent matches the given parent id.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM locations l LEFT JOIN locations_websites lw ON lw.location_id=l.id JOIN termlists_terms tt ON tt.id = l.location_type_id JOIN terms t ON t.id = tt.term_id LEFT JOIN locations lLatestChild on lLatestChild.created_on in (select max(created_on) from locations where parent_id=l.id) AND lLatestChild.location_type_id=#count_unit_boundary_type_id# --Get the preferred boundary id value LEFT JOIN location_attribute_values prefAttrVal on prefAttrVal.location_id = l.id and prefAttrVal.location_attribute_id = #preferred_boundary_attribute_id# --If a preferred boundary is not set, then we assumed latest boundary is preferred LEFT JOIN locations preferredLoc on preferredLoc.id = COALESCE(prefAttrVal.int_value,lLatestChild.id) LEFT JOIN locations lLatestChildNormalUser on lLatestChildNormalUser.created_on in (select max(created_on) from locations where parent_id=l.id AND created_by_id = #current_user_id# AND created_on > preferredLoc.created_on) AND lLatestChildNormalUser.location_type_id=#count_unit_boundary_type_id# --Admin users will always see the preferred boundary, if this is not set then latest is assumed to be preferred. --Normal users will see the latest boundary they have added themselves since the preferred boundary was created, --if this is not available, then they see the preferred boundary using the same rules as an admin user. LEFT JOIN locations locToShow on (locToShow.id = COALESCE(prefAttrVal.int_value, lLatestChild.id) and #admin_mode#=1) or (locToShow.id = COALESCE(lLatestChildNormalUser.id,prefAttrVal.int_value,lLatestChild.id) and #admin_mode#=0) and locToShow.location_type_id=#count_unit_boundary_type_id# #joins# WHERE 1=1 #filters# AND ((#website_filter# AND lw.deleted = false ) or l.public=true) AND l.deleted = false AND tt.deleted = false AND t.deleted = false

param.name: parent_id
param.join: JOIN locations lp on st_intersects(lp.boundary_geom, l.centroid_geom) and lp.id=#parent_id#
